body: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/oto4-hHdKDGbQtxgL6*QRRGlV-bN9BFHVfeyRFvl3SiLIUzief35Y7Q9dTZiPnnLlRYjrrMgkBeqTc*Z1fRxTpeaTRiyGR5Z/Canvasat212244.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/oto4-hHdKDE-ZeadrmA2F-doVrLN9O1ruEo1b4Wp-ygEwEZARSjLRS3ITq2pChUvkoBBrHzkXyP7h5oFcMxtzZQmKK10e-pS/Canvasat212244.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/oto4-hHdKDE19R*0RXwkVNwdh-pRmJlvh2ZI2JDPbNgeMJVmtSzu3FhNLyIhn4PuvCeqNic5I83c7E8Ipg-kJilCcPjiO1TZ/Canvasat212441.png)Hello Guys, I'm running a small daylight analysis before bedtime. And I encounter this problem. I have 2 massing one in a L shape the other a simple rectangle. Both of them are connected trough one wall (see the image) 1. Mass to zones does not create the first floor of one of the massing (the L shaped one) 2. Add glazing by ratio (the one that lets you chose to brake up the windows or not) creates a strange window Srf. at the connection of the L shaped massing. Attached the GH and Rhino file. Any Ideas Thank you all
